name: graphql
description: A Query Language and Runtime which can target any service.

repo.name: graphql-js
repo.description: A reference implementation of GraphQL for JavaScript

readme.top_issue: Configuration options (like NODE_ENV=production) are mentioned but not comprehensively documented in the README itself

critical_findings: No critical findings were identified, but it is recommended to validate user input for the 'fragmentName' variable.
security.summary: The provided code snippet appears to be secure with no major security concerns found, but some minor issues related to input validation and error handling were identified.

common_complaints: Incomplete/unclear upgrade documentation for major versions
Custom scalar handling edge cases (AST conversion, variable support)
Schema validation limitations for introspected schemas
Error handling improvements needed for async resolvers
praise_themes: Active roadmap planning for v17 with community input
Reproduction cases and proposed fixes provided by users
Long-term project maintenance and version evolution
sentiment.summary: GraphQL-JS shows healthy maintenance with active v17 planning, but moderate frustration exists around documentation clarity and custom scalar edge cases that should be addressed.

concerns: No merged PRs in past 6 months
No closed issues in past 6 months
No active contributors in past 6 months
maintenance.summary: The graphql package shows clear signs of abandonment with zero activity across all maintenance indicators over the past 6 months and a large backlog of unaddressed issues.

project_metrics.description: A reference implementation of GraphQL for JavaScript

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The README provides a good introduction to the package and its usage, but could benefit from more examples and troubleshooting guidance.
concerns: Low number of merged PRs in the past 6 months (35)
Docs: Lack of comprehensive troubleshooting section
Community: astFromValue fails with custom scalar serializing to an object value
Community: Custom scalars should allow variables in list literals
Security: No critical findings were identified, but it is recommended to validate user input for the 'fragmentName' variable.
Supply Chain: Publisher not in maintainers list
highlights: Some recent activity with 8 commits and 4 contributors active in the past 6 months
